waterConservation.title: Water Conservation
waterConservation.pageDescription: Learn efficient water management techniques to reduce usage while maintaining crop health and productivity.
waterConservation.bannerText: Water conservation is essential for sustainable farming and environmental protection. Implement these practices to make a difference.
waterConservation.noTipsAvailable: No water conservation tips are currently available. Please check back later.
waterConservation.fact1: Agriculture accounts for about 70% of all freshwater withdrawals globally, and up to 90% in some fast-growing economies.
waterConservation.fact2: Drip irrigation can reduce water usage by up to 60% compared to conventional flood irrigation methods.

soilHealth.title: Soil Health
soilHealth.pageDescription: Monitor and improve your soil health for optimal crop growth and sustainable farming practices.
soilHealth.moistureMessage: Your soil moisture levels are in the optimal range for paddy cultivation.

recommendations.title: Recommendations
recommendations.dry: Your soil is too dry. Increase irrigation frequency and consider adding mulch to retain moisture.
recommendations.moderate: Soil moisture is acceptable but could be improved. Monitor water levels and adjust irrigation as needed.
recommendations.optimal: Your soil moisture is ideal. Maintain current irrigation practices and continue monitoring.
recommendations.wet: Your soil is too wet. Reduce irrigation and ensure proper drainage to prevent root rot.
recommendations.unknown: Could not determine soil status. Please check your sensors or contact support.

tips.content1: Healthy soil is the foundation of successful sustainable farming. Here are some practices to maintain and improve soil health:
tips.bullet1: Rotate crops to prevent nutrient depletion and pest problems
tips.bullet2: Use cover crops during off-seasons to prevent erosion and add organic matter
tips.bullet3: Apply organic fertilizers and compost to improve soil structure and fertility
tips.content2: Soil pH affects nutrient availability to plants. For paddy cultivation, maintaining a slightly acidic to neutral pH (5.5-6.5) is optimal. Regular testing and appropriate amendments can help keep your soil at the ideal pH level.

testing.title: Soil Testing Methods
testing.description: Regular soil testing is crucial for understanding your soil's needs and making informed decisions about fertilization and amendments.
testing.professionalContent: Send soil samples to a certified laboratory for comprehensive analysis of nutrients, pH, organic matter, and potential contaminants.
testing.contactLab: Find a testing lab near you →
testing.diyContent: Use at-home testing kits to get basic information about your soil's pH, nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium levels.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To empower farmers with knowledge and technology for sustainable agriculture that improves yields while protecting the environment.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A world where sustainable farming practices are widely adopted, ensuring food security and environmental health for future generations.

values.title: Our Values
values.description: Sustainability, education, innovation, and community empowerment guide everything we do at FarmSustain.

ourStory.title: Our Story
ourStory.paragraph1: FarmSustain was founded in 2020 by a group of agricultural scientists, technologists, and farmers who recognized the need for better educational resources and tools for sustainable farming practices in rural areas.
ourStory.paragraph2: Starting with a small pilot project focused on paddy cultivation, we quickly expanded our scope to include water conservation, soil health management, and other key aspects of sustainable agriculture. Our initial success came from our hands-on approach, working directly with farming communities to understand their challenges and develop practical solutions.
ourStory.paragraph3: Today, FarmSustain serves thousands of farmers across the country, providing multilingual resources, AI-powered assistance, and real-time data to support sustainable farming decisions. We continue to grow and adapt, always guided by our commitment to environmental stewardship and farmer prosperity.

education.title: Farmer Education
education.description: We provide comprehensive educational resources on sustainable farming practices, crop management, and environmental conservation in multiple languages.

technology.title: Technology Integration
technology.description: We harness AI, weather data, and mobile technology to make advanced farming knowledge accessible to all farmers, regardless of literacy or technical background.

sustainability.title: Sustainability Advocacy
sustainability.description: We promote water conservation, soil health, and eco-friendly pest management techniques that protect natural resources while maintaining crop yields.

community.title: Community Building
community.description: We connect farmers with experts and each other to share knowledge, experiences, and support for implementing sustainable practices.
